abstract.p: Sixth annual Book Arts Symposium is scheduled at Rutgers University-Newark's John Cotton Dana Library (S)

block.p: The term ''Book Arts'' can mean fine papers, calligraphy, bindings and prints. It can also mean works of art that play with the book form.

''I think we in the New Jersey book arts have taken a very broad definition that covers both,'' said Lynn Mullins, director of the John Cotton Dana Library at Rutgers University-Newark, which will be holding its sixth annual Book Arts Symposium on Friday.
The term ''Book Arts'' can mean fine papers, calligraphy, bindings and prints. It can also mean works of art that play with the book form.

''I think we in the New Jersey book arts have taken a very broad definition that covers both,'' said Lynn Mullins, director of the John Cotton Dana Library at Rutgers University-Newark, which will be holding its sixth annual Book Arts Symposium on Friday.

The symposium, which runs from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., will include hands-on workshops, exhibitions and talks by New Jersey book artists. Among the presenters will be Clare Romano, the printmaker who with John Ross wrote the definitive text, ''The Complete Printmaker.'' Registration is $25. Information: (973) 353-5222.
